meanings.definition: To cut or shape incorrectly or inaccurately.
meanings.sent1: She kept miscutting the paper while trying to make a snowflake.
meanings.sent2: The tailor was worried about miscutting the fabric for the dress.
meanings.sent3: The chef's miscutting of the vegetables turned the stir-fry into a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to fix the shelf ended up miscutting the wood beyond repair.
meanings.sent5: The barber's miscutting of the hair left the customer with a unique hairstyle.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting or shaping something incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: The miscutting of the cake made it look lopsided.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter had to fix the miscutting in the wooden table.
meanings.sent3: The miscutting of the jigsaw puzzle pieces made it impossible to complete.
meanings.sent4: The miscutting of the key turned it into a useless piece of metal.
meanings.sent5: The miscutting of the fabric resulted in a dress that didn't fit properly.
